pull.title: net, refactor: Kill proxy globals
pull.body:
This PR moves the proxy info globals into their own component `ProxyManager` which `CConnman` is made to hold an instance of.

The alternative here would be to move the proxy info data directly into `CConnman` but it seems a little nicer for testing to have this be a self contained component.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#26609](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26609) (refactor: Move `txmempool_entry.h` --> `kernel/mempool_entry.h` by hebasto)
* [#26441](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26441) (rpc, p2p: add `addpermissionflags` RPC by brunoerg)
* [#26261](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26261) (p2p: cleanup `LookupIntern`, `Lookup` and `LookupHost` by brunoerg)
* [#26114](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26114) (net: Make AddrFetch connections to fixed seeds by mzumsande)
* [#25619](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25619) (net: avoid overriding non-virtual ToString() in CService and use better naming by vasild)
* [#25572](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25572) (refactor: Introduce EvictionManager and use it for the inbound eviction logic by dergoegge)
* [#25515](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25515) (net, test: Virtualise CConnman and add initial PeerManager unit tests by dergoegge)
* [#25390](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25390) (sync: introduce a thread-safe generic container and use it to remove a bunch of "GlobalMutex"es by vasild)
* [#25268](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25268) (refactor: Introduce EvictionManager by dergoegge)
* [#25136](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25136) (Torcontrol opt check by amadeuszpawlik)
* [#20018](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20018) (p2p: ProcessAddrFetch(-seednode) is unnecessary if -connect is specified by dhruv)
* [#19461](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19461) (multiprocess: Add bitcoin-gui -ipcconnect option by ryanofsky)
* [#19460](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19460) (multiprocess: Add bitcoin-wallet -ipcconnect option by ryanofsky)
* [#10102](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10102) (Multiprocess bitcoin by ryanofsky)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

events.message: [net] Move SOCKS5 proxy code into socks5.{h,cpp}
[net] ProxyManager::HasProxy should only return true for valid addresses

events.body:
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
🐙 This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).
I guess it could still make sense to do a move-only build system change to move proxy/socks out of the bins that don't need it (wallet, util, cli, ...)?

> I guess it could still make sense to do a move-only build system change to move proxy/socks out of the bins that don't need it (wallet, util, cli, ...)?

+1

I did that in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/fa02d161585d5c9f69a0bdc9677cefc8845e4ab2, but I am not sure how useful it is.

Maybe it would make more sense to create a separate net_utils library?

comments.body:
Any reason to put this in common? I'd expect it can live next to conman, as the cli or wallet shouldn't be using this, no?

Might be better to put into `node/proxy.cpp`?
